home.description: Send text via BLE (Web Bluetooth) to the Flusher, which types it accurately on the Target PC as USB keyboard (HID) input.
home.caution1: Intended for testing/development automation/demo purposes on systems you own/manage or in explicitly authorized environments.
home.caution2: Do not use for unauthorized access, security bypass, unauthorized input, or any illegal/unethical purpose.
home.caution3: Due to keyboard input automation, input may go to unintended locations due to focus changes/popups/UAC/notifications. Verify in a test environment first.
home.archFlusher: Flusher: BLE receive → buffer → USB HID keyboard output
home.archTarget: Target PC: Receives USB keyboard input to create text/scripts
home.textFlushDesc: Send text via BLE to type on Target PC
home.fileFlushDesc: Create/verify files on Target PC via script

text.textareaPlaceholder: Text entered here will be typed on the Target PC.
text.procedureSummary: Text preprocessing (replacement/whitespace options) → BLE packet splitting (chunks) → Start → (optional) device timing settings → chunk transmission loop (writeValue) → device (USB HID) types → complete (Stop/done)
text.metricsNote: Metric meanings: ETA/Basis are values calculated from input/settings (previewable), Progress is an approximation based on sent bytes ratio, Start/Elapsed/End are wall-clock based.
text.cautionFocusCheck: Check cursor/focus position on the Target PC before starting.
text.cautionEnglishMode: Set Target PC input method to English mode before starting (automatic KR/EN sync is not guaranteed).
text.noteBluetooth: Web Bluetooth only works in Chrome/Edge.
text.noteUSB: Target PC must allow USB keyboard devices.
text.noteFocusStart: Place the cursor at the target input position on the Target PC before starting (Flush).
text.noteBLESplit: BLE transfers have length limits and are split by default.

files.targetDirHint: Enter the directory on the Target PC where files will be created.
files.targetDirAsciiHint: ASCII only, no spaces. (Recommended: use a path under user folder to avoid permission issues)
files.sourceSelectHint: Select file(s) or folder to create on the Target PC.
files.multiFileDesc: Select a single file or folder to create files on the Target PC under targetDir, preserving the selected structure. Each file is verified with SHA-256 after creation; mismatches/failures stop immediately with an error. If the run completes and no error report (targetDir\.tmp\bf_last_error.txt) is generated, the created files are error-free.
files.overwritePolicyHint: Behavior when a target file already exists. Keep 'fail' by default; use overwrite/backup only when needed.
files.cautionAuthBold: Authorized environments only: Intended for testing/development automation/demo purposes on systems you own/manage or in explicitly authorized environments.
files.cautionIllegalFiles: Do not use for unauthorized access, security bypass, unauthorized file creation/input, or any illegal/unethical purpose.
files.cautionTargetDir: Target directory: absolute path / ASCII only / no spaces
files.cautionInput: Input: one top-level folder or one file
files.cautionPowerShell: PowerShell: auto-launched via Win+R (vulnerable to focus/popup/UAC/IME)
files.cautionFocusSteal: Even without user interaction, system UI (notifications/antivirus/updates/UAC) can steal focus and cause failure
files.cautionRecommend: Recommended: screen saver/auto-lock/sleep OFF, notifications OFF, no mouse/keyboard use during operation
files.cautionUserFolder: Recommended: use a path under user folder to avoid permission issues (e.g. C:\Users\me\...)
files.procedureSummary: PowerShell launch (Win+R) → console warmup/BF_READY → launcher install (bf_boot_append/run) → bootstrap send (bf_boot_append…) → bootstrap execute (bf_boot_run) → file loop (prepare_out → tmp_reset → tmp_append… → commit) → decode (WriteAllBytes) → SHA-256 verify (Get-FileHash) → cleanup (.tmp delete) → done
files.stageMapping: Stage display mapping: Prepare (Win+R/warmup/BF_READY) → Boot (launcher+bootstrap install) → Send (Base64 chunk input) → Decode (WriteAllBytes) → Verify (Get-FileHash) → Cleanup (temp file delete)
files.noteVerify: Verification uses SHA-256; mismatches stop immediately.
files.noteTempFiles: Temporary Base64 files are auto-created as targetDir\.tmp\bf_payload_<auto>.b64; existing temp files are deleted before start.
files.noteAutoDir: If targetDir does not exist, folders are created automatically.
files.notePermission: May fail depending on security policy/write permissions.
files.noteDiagLog: When diagnostic logging is enabled, targetDir\.tmp\bf_last_error.txt may be created on failure.
files.settingsTypingDelayHint: Wait time after each keystroke. Too short may cause drops in console/IME environments. (Aggressive tuning possible: 0~)
files.settingsKeyPressDelayHint: How long a key is held down. Too short may not register in some environments.
files.settingsLineDelayHint: Stabilization wait after Enter. Helps in environments with slow command processing/screen refresh.
files.settingsCommandDelayHint: Wait after a PowerShell command (one line) before the next (important for chunk loops).
files.settingsBootChunkCharsHint: Determines how many characters per bf_boot_append chunk (bootstrap -EncodedCommand Base64). Longer is faster but increases risk of keystroke drops.
files.settingsChunkCharsHint: Determines how many characters per Base64 chunk. Longer is faster but increases error/drop risk.
files.settingsChunkDelayHint: Wait after sending one chunk before the next (for input/processing stabilization).
files.settingsRunDialogDelayHint: Wait for the Run dialog to fully gain focus after Win+R.
files.settingsPsLaunchDelayHint: Wait for PowerShell to open and the prompt to become ready for input.
files.settingsBootstrapDelayHint: Stabilization wait after bootstrap script initialization before continuing.
files.settingsDiagLogHint: On failure, writes error log to targetDir\.tmp\bf_last_error.txt.
files.checkTargetDirInvalid: Target directory: absolute path (ASCII, no spaces) required
files.hintChunkCharsRange: Chunk length (Chars) must be between 200 and 10000.
files.hintBootChunkCharsRange: Bootstrap chunk length (Chars) must be between 50 and 4000.

settings.chunkSizeHint: Data size sent via BLE at once. Too large may increase failure rate.
settings.chunkDelayHint: Wait time between chunks (for transfer stabilization).
settings.retryDelayHint: Wait time before reconnect/retry on disconnect or failure.
settings.unsupportedReplacementHint: Characters not on the keyboard will be replaced with this string.
settings.ignoreLeadingWhitespaceHint: Leading spaces/tabs on each line will not be sent (useful for IDE auto-formatting).
settings.typingDelayHint: Wait time after each keystroke. Too short may cause missed/garbled characters (especially HID/IME).
settings.modeSwitchDelayHint: Stabilization wait after IME toggle. Too short may cause input in the wrong mode.
settings.keyPressDelayHint: How long a key is held down. Too short may not register in some environments.
settings.timingNote: These values affect the actual typing speed/stability on the board (USB HID).
